definitions.definition: Anything that seems to be something that it is not.
examples: We saw what looked like a tiger among the trees, but it was an illusion caused by the shadows of the branches.
Using artificial additives, scientists can create the illusion of fruit flavours in food.

definitions.definition: A misapprehension ; a belief in something that is in fact not true.
examples: Jane has this illusion that John is in love with her.

definitions.definition: The state of being deceived or misled.

main_definition: ( countable ) Anything that seems to be something that it is not.
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A misapprehension ; a belief in something that is in fact not true.
( uncountable ) The state of being deceived or misled.
